00018 int
00019 wapi_make_socket(void)
00020 {
00021     return socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
00022 }

00024 
00025 int
00026 wapi_get_ifnames(wapi_list_t *list)
00027 {
00028     FILE *fp;
00029     int ret;
00030     size_t tmpsize = WAPI_PROC_LINE_SIZE * sizeof(char);
00031     char tmp[WAPI_PROC_LINE_SIZE];
00032 
00033     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(list);
00034 
00035     /* Open file for reading. */
00036     fp = fopen(WAPI_PROC_NET_WIRELESS, "r");
00037     if (!fp)
00038     {
00039         WAPI_STRERROR("fopen(\"%s\", \"r\")", WAPI_PROC_NET_WIRELESS);
00040         return -1;
00041     }
00042 
00043     /* Skip first two lines. */
00044     if (!fgets(tmp, tmpsize, fp) || ! fgets(tmp, tmpsize, fp))
00045     {
00046         WAPI_ERROR("Invalid \"%s\" content!\n", WAPI_PROC_NET_WIRELESS);
00047         return -1;
00048     }
00049 
00050     /* Iterate over available lines. */
00051     ret = 0;
00052     while (fgets(tmp, tmpsize, fp))
00053     {
00054         char *beg;
00055         char *end;
00056         wapi_string_t *string;
00057 
00058         /* Locate the interface name region. */
00059         for (beg = tmp; *beg && isspace(*beg); beg++);
00060         for (end = beg; *end && *end != ':'; end++);
00061 
00062         /* Allocate both wapi_string_t and char vector. */
00063         string = malloc(sizeof(wapi_string_t));
00064         if (string) string->data = malloc(end - beg + sizeof(char));
00065         if (!string || !string->data)
00066         {
00067             WAPI_STRERROR("malloc()");
00068             ret = -1;
00069             break;
00070         }
00071 
00072         /* Copy region into the buffer. */
00073         snprintf(string->data, (end - beg + sizeof(char)), "%s", beg);
00074 
00075         /* Push string into the list. */
00076         string->next = list->head.string;
00077         list->head.string = string;
00078     }
00079 
00080     fclose(fp);
00081     return ret;
00082 }
00083

00085 #define wapi_ioctl_command_name_bufsiz 128  /* Is fairly enough to print an integer. */
00086 static char wapi_ioctl_command_name_buf[wapi_ioctl_command_name_bufsiz];
00087 
00088 
00089 const char *
00090 wapi_ioctl_command_name(int cmd)
00091 {
00092     switch (cmd)
00093     {
00094     case SIOCADDRT:     return "SIOCADDRT";
00095     case SIOCDELRT:     return "SIOCDELRT";
00096     case SIOCGIFADDR:   return "SIOCGIFADDR";
00097     case SIOCGIWAP:     return "SIOCGIWAP";
00098     case SIOCGIWESSID:  return "SIOCGIWESSID";
00099     case SIOCGIWFREQ:   return "SIOCGIWFREQ";
00100     case SIOCGIWMODE:   return "SIOCGIWMODE";
00101     case SIOCGIWRANGE:  return "SIOCGIWRANGE";
00102     case SIOCGIWRATE:   return "SIOCGIWRATE";
00103     case SIOCGIWSCAN:   return "SIOCGIWSCAN";
00104     case SIOCGIWTXPOW:  return "SIOCGIWTXPOW";
00105     case SIOCSIFADDR:   return "SIOCSIFADDR";
00106     case SIOCSIWAP:     return "SIOCSIWAP";
00107     case SIOCSIWESSID:  return "SIOCSIWESSID";
00108     case SIOCSIWFREQ:   return "SIOCSIWFREQ";
00109     case SIOCSIWMODE:   return "SIOCSIWMODE";
00110     case SIOCSIWRATE:   return "SIOCSIWRATE";
00111     case SIOCSIWSCAN:   return "SIOCSIWSCAN";
00112     case SIOCSIWTXPOW:  return "SIOCSIWTXPOW";
00113     default:
00114         snprintf(
00115             wapi_ioctl_command_name_buf, wapi_ioctl_command_name_bufsiz,
00116             "0x%x", cmd);
00117         return wapi_ioctl_command_name_buf;
00118     }
00119 }
